questions.question: What is true regarding the statement beginning with #! that is found in the first line of a script?
choices: It prevents the script from being executed until the ! is removed.
It specifies the path and the arguments of the interpreter used to run the script.
It is a comment that is ignored by the script.
It specifies the character encoding of the script.
